content:
That's a great question! I've always been a huge fan of Diane Arbus's work. Her portraits from the 1960s are so hauntingly beautiful and intimate. The way she captures the quirks and nuances of her subjects is really inspiring to me. I also love the work of Lee Friedlander and Garry Winogrand - their street photography from the 1960s is so evocative of the era.

But I think what really draws me to 1960s photography is the sense of experimentation and pushing boundaries that was happening during that time. It was an era of great social change, and photographers were reflecting that in their work. They were pushing the boundaries of what photography could do, experimenting with new techniques and styles... it's really inspiring to see.

And I have to say, my recent acquisition of a 1960s film camera has really gotten me excited to experiment with my own photography. I've been shooting with it and trying to capture some of
